title: World War II: From Origins to Aftermath
description: Understand history's most consequential conflict through expert historians who have dedicated their careers to understanding World War II. This course features PhD historians, university professors, and leading scholars from institutions including Cambridge, Oxford, UCL, Stanford, the U.S. Naval Academy, and more. Learn from Ian Kershaw (the definitive Hitler biographer), Andrew Roberts (Churchill expert), Antony Beevor (legendary military historian knighted for his work), Craig Symonds (America's preeminent naval historian), and Benjamin Ferencz (the last surviving Nuremberg prosecutor). The course progresses from the war's origins and major turning points through military operations and the home front, to the profound moral questions, consequences, and lasting impact that shaped the modern world.
